name: NSPageController
desc: An object that controls swipe navigation and animations between views or view content.

items.name: protocol NSPageControllerDelegate
items.desc: The NSPageControllerDelegate protocol allows you to customize the behavior of instances of the NSPageController class.

items.name: var arrangedObjects: [Any]
items.desc: An array containing the objects displayed in the page controller’s view.

items.name: var selectedIndex: Int
items.desc: The currently selected object in the arranged objects array.

items.name: func navigateBack(Any?)
items.desc: Navigates backwards in the page controller’s arranged objects array.

items.name: func navigateForward(Any?)
items.desc: Navigates to the next object in the page controller’s arranged objects array, if appropriate.

items.name: func takeSelectedIndexFrom(Any?)
items.desc: Navigates to the selected index, which is taken from the sender.

items.name: var transitionStyle: NSPageController.TransitionStyle
items.desc: The transition style the page controller uses when changing pages.

items.name: func completeTransition()
items.desc: Invoked when the page transition is completed.

items.name: var selectedViewController: NSViewController?
items.desc: The view controller associated with the selected object..

items.name: enum NSPageController.TransitionStyle
items.desc: These constants control the transition style of the page controller.
